No se guien por las horas que muestra al lado de la reseña, eso es porque ejecuta el launcher y al jugar se cierra y no reconoce las horas. Ahora bien. Fallout 3... o Guía de Supervivencia Nuclear para Mañana. No busca ser igual que los Fallout originales, Bethesda no tuvo miedo en experimentar y eso está bien, pero definitivamente se siente que cambian cosas de manera arbitraria, como nerfear la armadura de poder o los Deathclaw. Por otro lado el juego es muy inmersivo, didáctico y espectacularmente diseñado (menos las paredes invisibles en el mapa), pero faltan más opciones ambiguas de diálogo, la  historia no dice mucho pero acción no falta, y debemos rescatar a Liam Neeson. Tiene un factor de terror y suspenso que lo diferencia del resto. Especialmente al comienzo cuando todavía se está en un nivel bajo y hasta las radroachs puede matarte. Es recomendado, pero no significa que es perfecto, tiene crasheos constantes, así que guardar constantemente es imperativo.
En cuanto a los DLC,
Operation Anchorage: muy bueno, aunque se sienta medio fuera de estilo una simulación de realidad virtual en el mundo de Fallout, pero es corta y divertida, bastante fácil.

The Pitt: Un poco más desafiante que Anchorage, nos transporta a Pittsburgh para ayudar a los esclavos metaleros y tiene un mayor dilema moral.

Broken Steel: Necesario para seguir jugando después de terminar la Main Quest, es mucho más largo y hasta se vuelve tedioso y los enemigos muy esponja, pero si te gusta la Hermandad de Acero vale la pena.

Fallout 3 gets hate from people who have not truly invested the time to appreciate the game. Granted, the main quest is largely linear and doesn't possess the nuance of choice that later Fallout titles provide. However, taking the time to explore the world reveals a really well-built environment that, at least in my opinion, is truer to the original Fallout titles than Fallout 4, 76, and even to some extent New Vegas. Fallout 3 requires patience and a desire to fully appreciate the worldbuilding, and in a modern era of FPS Battle Royales and competitive shooters, it just does not get the investment of time it deserves. The more I play Fallout 3, the more it becomes my favorite Fallout game, which is ironic considering I started with New Vegas and swore off 3 because of its more antiquated mechanics
This game makes doing slave labour fun

If you'd like the best experience of Fallout 3, I'd suggest the "Tale of Two Wastelands" mod for Fallout New Vegas

I have to admit this, I am not a patient RPG player, although I really enjoy playing the games, I cannot get past the whole leveling up process (which is basically the whole point to an RPG), the time it takes, slowly getting stronger by one small XP inch at a time. That being said, maxing a character out in Fallout 3 does not take all that long to accomplish, which for me was a relief. That being said... I probably added three quarters+ of my XP through the XP console cheat, then I set the game at the hardest setting, which, for all insects and purchases, let me play the game mostly as a shooter... and I enjoyed every moment of it, but in all fairness Fallout 3 actually does do a great job of doling out XP, Perks and other upgrades for further character development.

I explored everywhere and everything. I took my time and soaked everything in. One can play this game following through the main story quests arc, (although I would highly advise against it for the sake of fun), or get busy checking stuff out in the Capitol Wasteland and getting side-quests accidentally, then, when you feel like it, move the main story along. That later process was a cool way of letting the game unfold organically. The characters, and dialogue in this effort are far more developed, flushed out, and natural sounding than in Oblivion, which had this incredibly annoying glitch by where a character's initial contact voice was different than it's dialogue tree voice... weird.

This game is thoughtful and emotional. After my initial sadness after it ended, as I had spent hours and many late nights returning to the world, I started the whole process again, this time with different goals, tactics and character development. There is supposed to be some downloadable content coming for this game in January, February and March of 09, (as of this writing there is a bunch of DLC available) I can't wait. That being said...

Graphics: A+ | Sound: A+ | Playability: A+
If I could only play one game until the end of time, this would be it.

Fallout - це улюблена гра для багатьох людей, любого віку і статі, достатку і світогляду. Це цікава і чудова гра про паралельний апокаліптичний світ. Світ, де країни вирішили, що ядерна війна - це прям неймовірно чудова ідея і масово пожмякали червоні кнопочки. Світ, де вижило зовсім маленька кількість людей (більша частина яких жила у спец.сховищах). Зате, розмножилась і мутувала велика кількість самих різних тваринок. До них доєднались мутовані люди, що стали гулями (живі зомбі) і супер-мутанти (воєнна розробка, що вийшла з під контролю).
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3530830564
Веселе, повне хаосу і кримінальних одиниць, місце. Частинка світу, де життя коштує менше спаленого паперу. Де постійно йдуть бої за ресурси, чисту воду і їжу. Де процвітає рабство, а роботи і андроїди додають свою струю багряної і гарячої крові. Місце, де ти можеш покластися тільки на себе і на того, хто прикриє твою спину. І тільки від тебе залежить чи прикриють тобі спину, чи вирішать прирізати за кошель кришечок. Місце, де найвірнішим другом і соратником часто може стати лише собака.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3529955668
А щодо історії гри, то тут кожна фракція має свій інтерес і гешефт. І, навіть, довоєнні сховища мають свої зловісні секретики. Безпосередньо в цій частині ми маємо головного героя/героїню, що шукає свого блудного батька. І дізнаємося, що наш батько справжній герой, він (як і мати колись) мріє про чисту воду "даром і для всіх". І за цю мрію віддає своє життя, покладаючи цей тягар мрії на наші плечі. Ми маємо 2 фракції, що хочуть підгрести проект під себе і можемо обрати одну з них. Тут у вас свобода дії, ви можете врятувати цей світ, просякнутий кров'ю і хаосом, а можете й знищити.

Також, ви можете грати за святого героя, допомагаючи всім навколо і підвищуючи свою карму. А можете грати за зловісного поганця, від якого тікають, навіть, розбійники. Це ваш шлях, ваш вибір і пройти його можете саме ви.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3514214090

Fallout 3 GOTY é uma experiencia meio conturbada, as vezes acontece um bug que quase faz você perder tudo, boa parte dos interiores é um labirinto, etc.
Os pontos positivos, o mapa é grande, tem bastante coisa pra explorar, os inimigos vão dificultando conforme você sobe de nível, armas bem fortes no começo que são fácil de pegar, etc.
o jogo é bom, mas eu tive uma dificuldade pra iniciar, tive que fazer umas modificações nos arquivos do jogo pra conseguir jogar. Já as DLC's são bem fáceis, a única que senti dificuldade foi na Operation Anchorage.
A Mothership Zeta é um labirinto de corredores, confuso e chato, pelo menos as armas são decentes, Point Lookout não tem nada de mais.
The Pitt é uma DLC mediana, com algumas armas nova, tem que ir na pqp pra acessar todas as DLC's.
Não vou avaliar o Broken Steel porque bugou e não consegui avanlar na DLC. 7/10

Fallout 3 is New Vegas’s less popular older-brother-with-a-different-father. It’s less about role-playing, more about world building. But some of the best action-RPG mechanics were built with Fallout 3.

Compared to the superb writings in New Vegas, Fallout 3’s dialogues lack any sort of nuance. You won’t find the role-playing experience with interesting choices and reactions as they are in New Vegas. However, I find the Capital Wasteland to be a much more interesting backdrop compared to the Mojave, especially with the interconnecting metro system and several urban dungeons in D.C. I appreciate the locations where the developers have taken close inspirations from their real-life counterparts; the ruined city sells the post-apocalyptic setting better than a map that is almost entirely desert.

Let’s also not forget about the gameplay mechanics—the game [i]is[/i] fun to play. The satisfaction when body-parts fly around or explode after you hit a critical shot, the way you’re constantly presented with skill-checks in all aspects of game-play to feel your character builds up, or the often under-appreciated persistent open-world—these are all Bethesda’s works done well. Bethesda had gotten the tools right, and even though they didn’t end up using them nearly as well as Obsidian, Fallout 3 is still a title that deserves recognition for what it’s done for the franchise.

Fallout 3 might be showing its age, but there's still something special about it. The atmosphere is unmatched — bleak, immersive, and full of that classic post-apocalyptic charm. Exploring the ruins of Washington D.C., stumbling across bizarre side stories, and making morally gray choices still holds up surprisingly well.

The writing and world-building are standout features, and there’s a real sense of freedom in how you approach quests and character builds. Yes, the combat is a bit clunky and the UI isn’t great by today’s standards, but once you get past that (or throw on a few quality-of-life mods), it becomes a deeply rewarding experience.

If you’re into story-driven RPGs with exploration and player choice, Fallout 3 is still absolutely worth playing.
